newsitem.title: CZECH REPUBLIC: PRESS DIGEST -- Czech Republic -- Jan 8.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST -- Czech Republic -- Jan 8.

text.p: HOSPODARSKE NOVINY - Returns for the government budget for 1996 were 8.2 billion crowns less than estimated. Finance Minister Ivan Kocarnik lists reasons for this as economic growth being less than expected, late payments of Russian debt and a delay in social insurance payments by businesses.
- According to information, which is to be presented to the cabinet today by Trade Minister Vladimir Dlouhy, the main direction of government export policy must be the cultivation of economic growth.
- The new Justice Minister, Vlasta Parkanova, whose appointment President Havel approved yesterday, is, according to Havel, awaiting difficult tasks in an uneasy department.
- Privatisation of the agrarian sector and the food processing industry is two thirds finished. Decisions by 25 more businesses, including Budvar brewery, are necessary.

- In a meeting yesterday of ministers with the Environment Ministry about research on gold deposits in the Czech Republic and the possibility of mining it, ministers decided it is necessary to change and strengthen the government's role in the industry for the future.

- American Mobil Europe Gas Inc (MEGAS) is one of the preferred companies on the Czech cabinet's list of companies who will participate in providing diversified imports of natural gas to the Czech Republic. Mobil will operate with the the mediation of its subsidiary Mobil s.r.o. and of Aral.

PRAVO - The new pension law, which should be presented to the cabinet by Labour Minister Jindrich Vodicka, will coincide on fundamental points with the coalition agreement from the middle of December, and should make entrance age for pensioners two years earlier, while decreasing the amount paid to individual pensioners.

MLADA FRONTA DNES - British concern Bass Plc, which operates a strong group of breweries centralised in Prague, attained 10 percent of Radegast in the middle of 1996, increasing its stake in the company to 30 percent at the end of the year.
